macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. Stocks Rebound Sharply Across Major Indexes
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 1.21%, S&P 500 gained 1.16%, and Nasdaq Composite climbed 1.18% on Wednesday, rebounding from a recent selloff amid improved risk sentiment.

items.title: U.S. Markets Rally on Trump Greenland Tariff Pullback
items.summary: Treasury yields fell as President Trump's decision to back off threatened tariffs on Greenland eased geopolitical fears, boosting stocks while uncertainty persists over Fed leadership and upcoming economic data.

items.title: Bitcoin Dips Below $90,000 Amid Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Bitcoin briefly fell below $90,000 due to U.S.-Greenland disputes and Japan's fiscal concerns, trading at $90,226 mid-morning ET amid delays in U.S. crypto regulations.

items.title: Great Southern Bancorp Reports Strong Q4 Earnings
items.summary: Great Southern Bancorp announced preliminary fourth quarter earnings of $1.45 per diluted common share.

items.title: Uniti Group Prices Upsized Senior Notes Offering
items.summary: Uniti Group Inc. announced the pricing of an upsized senior notes offering.

items.title: Clearfield Schedules Fiscal Q1 2026 Earnings Call
items.summary: Clearfield set its fiscal first quarter 2026 earnings call for February 4, 2026.

items.title: Silvaco Group Celebrates Successful IPO
items.summary: Silvaco Group, Inc. CEO highlighted the company's IPO success and growth strategies in semiconductor design software.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin and Major Altcoins Rebound as Trump Drops EU Tariff Threats
items.summary: Bitcoin traded near $90K (up 0.5% to $89,872), BNB rose 1.3% to $892, Monero gained 4% to $512, and Sui increased 1.2% to $1.52, following U.S. President Trump's reversal on tariffs against eight EU countries tied to Greenland tensions, easing geopolitical fears and boosting risk appetite.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Volatility with $4 Billion Whale Movements Amid Institutional Buying
items.summary: Bitcoin experienced back-and-forth volatility with approximately $4 billion in BTC shifting between whales and institutions; a '5K BTC OG' wallet sold thousands, but spot ETFs and mid-sized holders absorbed supply, keeping prices around $89,829 (up 0.5%). Analysts eye $90K support and potential push to $97K if it holds above $94,500.

items.title: Total Crypto Market Cap Rises 0.8% to $3.12 Trillion on Easing Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: The overall cryptocurrency market capitalization increased 0.8% to about $3.12 trillion, with most major tokens posting modest gains despite extreme fear in sentiment indicators; Grayscale predicts Bitcoin new all-time high in H1 2026 due to institutional demand and regulatory clarity.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Mila and Inovia Capital Launch $100M Venture Scientist Fund for Canadian AI Startups
items.summary: Mila, Canada's leading AI research institute, and Inovia Capital announced the Venture Scientist Fund on January 21, 2026, targeting $100M to invest in over 55 AI-native companies from top Canadian universities. The fund aims to bridge the gap between Canada's 10% share of global AI research talent and its less than 2% of AI venture capital.

items.title: AI Launch Lab and Numana Introduce Quantum Ready Program for Students
items.summary: AI Launch Lab and Numana launched the Quantum Ready Program on January 21, 2026, providing Québec college students with hands-on training in quantum technologies, AI-enabled learning, and security challenges like post-quantum encryption.

items.title: Tech CEOs at Davos Predict AI Jobs Shift to Trade Skills for Datacenters
items.summary: NVIDIA's Jensen Huang and Palantir's Alex Karp stated at the World Economic Forum on January 22 that future AI jobs will require trade skills like hardhats and boots due to expanding AI datacenters, while Microsoft’s Satya Nadella emphasized long-term impacts.

items.title: Forrester Reports Only 10-15% of AI Pilots Scale in Organizations
items.summary: Forrester analysis indicates just 10-15% of AI pilots reach scale, with only 8-15% of roles being pure AI/ML positions as organizations reshape existing jobs rather than creating new ones.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct 2026 Scheduled for January 22
items.summary: Microsoft's Xbox Developer Direct is set to stream today at 1 PM ET, featuring multiple AAA game announcements and updates. The event will be available on Facebook, YouTube, and Twitch and is expected to last nearly an hour.

items.title: Netflix Games Prioritizes Cloud-First Strategy in 2026
items.summary: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters announced during earnings calls that cloud-based TV games represent a major advancement and priority for the company's gaming division in 2026.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Amazon Launches Largest Retail Store in Chicago Suburbs
items.summary: Amazon opened its largest-ever retail store in the Chicago suburbs with a footprint larger than many Big Box stores, marking a significant expansion of its physical retail presence.

items.title: Teledyne Technologies Reports Earnings Beat
items.summary: Teledyne Technologies, a maker of electronic instruments, reported quarterly earnings that exceeded Wall Street estimates, driving share price increases.

items.title: Fujitsu and Mizuho Bank Develop Order Processing Service for SMEs
items.summary: Fujitsu and Mizuho Bank announced a collaboration to create an automated order and payment processing service that reduces manual operations by up to 70% for small and medium-sized enterprises.

items.title: TSMC Reports Strong Results Amid Sustained Demand
items.summary: TSMC posted strong quarterly results and indicated that demand remains robust, reinforcing its critical role as the manufacturing backbone for the global compute industry.
